did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Prince William County (Va.) Deed Book (Liber A), 1731-1732

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Use microfilm copy, Prince William County (Va.) Reel 1.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Prince William County (Va.) Deed Book (Liber A), 1731-1732. Prince William County (Va.) Reel 1, Local government records collection, Prince William County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This item came to the Library of Virginia in a shipment of court papers from Prince William County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Prince William County was formed in 1730 from Stafford and King George Counties.
The deed book of Prince William County in this collection was created by the County Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Deed Book (Liber A), 1731-1732, of Prince William County Court. The deed book record the name of the grantor and grantee, the residence of both individuals and the description of property being sold or transferred. The volume has an index which contains the first and last names of both parties. It is arranged alphabetically from A-Z.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Prince William Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records On Microfilm" found on the Library of Virginia web site.
